news.title: EAGeR Medical Trial: Low-Dose Aspirin Won't Prevent Pregnancy Loss
news.summary: Women should talk to their health care providers before taking low dose aspirin or any other medication while attempting to get pregnant or during pregnancy. But based on this trial, general use of low-dose aspirin is not recommended

news.title: Low-dose aspirin not significantly associated with pregnancy loss
news.summary: The Effects of Aspirin in Gestation and Reproduction (EAGeR) medical trial has found that, in general, low-dose aspirin is not beneficial for future pregnancy outcomes in women with prior pregnancy loss.

news.title: EAGeR medical trial: Low-dose aspirin won't prevent pregnancy loss
news.summary: ( University at Buffalo ) The Effects of Aspirin in Gestation and Reproduction medical trial has found that, in general, low-dose aspirin is not beneficial for future pregnancy outcomes in women with prior pregnancy loss.

news.title: Low Dose Aspirin Does Not Reduce Pregnancy Loss
news.summary: The National Institutes of Health (NIH) reported that daily low dose aspirin therapy did not improve birth rates in most women with prior history of one or more pregnancy losses.

news.title: Low-dose aspirin won't prevent pregnancy loss, study shows

news.title: 1 in 5 pregnancies end in miscarriage. Why?

news.title: Morning sickness linked to lower risk of pregnancy loss
